description: The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for the overall strategy and direction of the company.

children.description: The Chief Technology Officer is responsible for the technological vision and direction of the company.
The Project Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and overseeing the completion of specific projects within the software development cycle.
The Product Owner is responsible for defining and prioritizing the features and requirements of the product being developed.
The Tech Lead is responsible for leading the technical team and making technical decisions related to the project.
The Frontend Developer is responsible for implementing the user interface and user experience of the product.
The Backend Developer is responsible for implementing the server-side logic and database interactions of the product.
The DevOps Engineer is responsible for managing the infrastructure and deployment processes of the product.
The QA Engineer is responsible for testing and ensuring the quality of the product.
The Scrum Master is responsible for facilitating the Scrum process and ensuring that the team follows Agile principles.
The Chief Financial Officer is responsible for managing the financial risks and financial planning of the company.
The Chef Accountant is responsible for managing the accounting and financial reporting of the company.
The Financial Analyst is responsible for analyzing financial data and making financial recommendations to management.
The Account and Payable role is responsible for managing accounts payable and other financial obligations of the company.
The Internal Audit role is responsible for reviewing and evaluating the company's financial and operational processes to ensure compliance with regulations and internal policies.
The Chief Operating Officer is responsible for overseeing day-to-day operations and ensuring that business operations are efficient and effective.
The Product Manager is responsible for managing the development, marketing, and overall success of a product.
The Operation Manager is responsible for managing operational processes to ensure that they are efficient, effective, and meet customer needs.
The Customer Relation role is responsible for managing relationships with customers, addressing customer concerns, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
The Human Resources role is responsible for managing employee relations, recruitment, training, and other HR functions within the company.
